articles.description: A DEVASTATING second wave of COVID-19 is possible and all countries must remain on alert for the eventuality, the World Health Organisation (WHO) told the BBC's Andrew Marr on Sunday.

articles.author: Charlotte Hadfield
articles.title: Social distancing in Liverpool during Spanish flu pandemic of 1918 and how restrictions were lifted - Liverpool Echo
articles.description: The Spanish flu infected around 500 million people worldwide
articles.content:
Until recently, the prospect of social distancing and having to self-isolate in our own homes was unfamiliar to us all.
 But since the country was put into lockdown on March 23, social distancing has become more important than ever in helping to slow the spr… [+5477 chars]

articles.author: Elisa Menendez
articles.title: Recovered coronavirus patients starting to show signs of immunity - Metro.co.uk
articles.description: England’s Deputy Chief Medical Officer Dr Jenny Harries said it was too early to say for certain but 'small pieces of evidence' are promising.
articles.content:
Dr Jenny Harries said emerging evidence is starting to show that recovered patients appear to retain Covid-19 antibodies for some time after (Picture: Reuters)
Recovered coronavirus patients are showing signs of immunity, Englands Deputy Chief Medical Office… [+4335 chars]

articles.title: How close are we to a coronavirus vaccine? Latest news on UK trials - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Latest news on the search for a vaccine against the new coronavirus
articles.content:
Results could be available as soon as September, the researchers say. The trial is not yet open to recruitment, but will be announced in due course.
